enWisdom: Many an admonisher does not [follow his admonishment and] deter himself [from sin]

Wisdom: لَمْ يَعْقِلْ مَوَاعِظَ الزَّمَانِ مَنْ سَكَنَ إِلَى حُسْنِ الظَّنِّ بِالْأَيَّامِ
enWisdom: One who finds tranquillity in thinking positively about the [passing] days has not understood the admonitions of time

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ أَمْلَكَ شَيْ‏ءٍ بِهِ عَقْلُهُ لَمْ يَنْتَفِعْ بِمَوْعِظَةٍ
enWisdom: One whose intellect does not have the greatest control over him does not benefit from [any] advice

Wisdom: لَا تَكُونَنَّ مِمَّنْ لَا تَنْفَعُهُ الْمَوْعِظَةُ إِلَّا إِذَا بَالَغْتَ فِي إِيلَامِهِ فَإِنَّ الْعَاقِلَ يَتَّعِظُ بِالْأَدَبِ وَالْبَهَائِمَ لَا تَرْتَدِعُ إِلَّا بِالضَّرْبِ
enWisdom: Never be one of those who do not benefit from admonition unless you give him a painful punishment, for indeed the intelligent one takes admonishment from discipline whereas beasts are not deterred except by beating
